responses: Hello! I'm here to answer your questions about Northwestern University's history.
Hi there! How can I help you learn about Northwestern?
Greetings! Ask me anything about the university's history.
Welcome! I am the Northwestern University History Chatbot. What can I tell you about?

patterns: What was the school originally called?
When did Northwestern Academy become a College?
What was the first year of operation?
Ano ang orihinal na pangalan ng paaralan?
Kailan naging Kolehiyo ang Northwestern Academy?
responses: Northwestern Academy, Inc. was incorporated in *1932*. It gained government permit to offer General Secondary, Commercial Secondary, and Home Economics in the same year.
The institution was originally founded as *Northwestern Academy, Inc.* in 1932.
The conversion from Northwestern Academy to *Northwestern College* occurred in *1949*.

patterns: When did the school become a University?
What year did they get University Status?
When was the official confirmation of University Status?
Anong taon nakuha ang University Status?
Kailan ang opisyal na kumpirmasyon ng University Status?
responses: Northwestern College was granted *University Status* in *1993*. The official confirmation was issued by the Ministry of Education, Culture and Sports on *January 13, 1994*.
The 50th founding anniversary of Northwestern College was celebrated in *1982*.

patterns: When was the Nalbo campus lot acquired?
Where is the main campus located?
When was the first computer center established?
When was the Alumni House completed?
Kailan nakuha ang lupa sa Nalbo campus?
Kailan itinatag ang unang computer center?
responses: The *8.9-hectare lot in Barangay Nalbo, Laoag City* was purchased in *1962*, and the relocation of some courses to the new campus began in 1969.
The *first computer center in Region I/Ilocos Region* was inaugurated and blessed in *1983*.
The *Alumni House* was completed in *2007*.

patterns: When was the Nursing program started?
When did the College of Law reopen?
When did they first offer engineering courses?
Kailan muling binuksan ang College of Law?
Kailan sila unang nag-alok ng engineering courses?
responses: The *BS in Nursing* program was first offered in *1973*.
The *BS in Criminology* program (now Criminal Justice) was first permitted in *1969*.
The *College of Law was reopened* (allowed to resume operation) in *1984*.

Initial Engineering programs were recognized in the 1970s, but Civil Engineering was added in 1960. Mechanical Engineering got government recognition in 1971, and Electrical Engineering in 1978. In 1990, BS Computer Engineering and BS in Electronics and Communication Engineering were added.
In 2005, new programs included BS in Library and Information Science, BS in Actuarial Science, BS in Statistics, and BS in Commerce major in E-Business.

patterns: What is the ISO certification status?
When did the programs get Level II accreditation?
What major awards did the university receive in 2004?
When did Northwestern get Deregulated Status?
Kailan nakakuha ng Level II accreditation?
Ano ang mga pangunahing parangal noong 2004?
Kailan nakuha ng Northwestern ang Deregulated Status?
responses: The university received *ISO 9001:1994* certification in *2000* and *ISO 9001:2000* certification in *2004*.
Initial Level II accreditation for major programs (Arts and Sciences, Commerce, Education) was granted in *1991*.
In *2004*, Northwestern University was ranked *3rd place nationally* by PACUCOA for the most accredited programs and *number one in Region I*.
The university was granted *Deregulated Status* by CHED in *2003*.

patterns: Who was the first university president?
When was Ben A. Nicolas first appointed president?
Kailan unang na-appoint si Ben A. Nicolas bilang presidente?
responses: *Jose G. Castro* is recognized as the *First University President* (appointed in 1989).

*Ben A. Nicolas* was a key leader, appointed president and chairman in 1982. He was later appointed university president in *1997* and was a visionary leader who pushed for university status and reforms.
Ben A. Nicolas was first appointed president of Northwestern College in *1982* and formally invested in 1983.
